alert.note: Alert for Northern San Joaquin Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 12:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central San Joaquin and central Stanislaus Counties through 1245 PM PDT... At 1159 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Modesto, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Modesto, Ceres, Oakdale, Manteca, Riverbank, Lathrop, Ripon, Escalon, West Modesto, Del Rio, Riverdale Park, Shackelford, Salida, Empire, Bret Harte, East Oakdale, Bystrom, Hughson, French Camp and Keyes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
